meanings.definition: A house or building, together with its land and outbuildings, occupied by a business or considered in an official context.
meanings.sent1: The company's premises were well-maintained and spacious.
meanings.sent2: The police arrived at the premises to investigate the reported break-in.
meanings.sent3: The premises seemed to have a mind of their own, always attracting customers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the premises like a beacon in the night.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur of the premises left a lasting impression on all who visited.

meanings.definition: A statement or proposition that forms the basis for a work or theory.
meanings.sent1: The scientist's theory was built on the premises of previous research.
meanings.sent2: The premises of the argument were flawed, leading to an incorrect conclusion.
meanings.sent3: The premises of the story were so outlandish that it became a bestseller.
meanings.sent4: His speech laid out the premises of a new era in technology.
meanings.sent5: The premises of the debate were carefully outlined to avoid misunderstandings.
